Chief Complaint: 79 M p/w STEMI from OSH, found to have 90% L-main,
   100% RCA and w/ cardiogenic shock requiring IABP.
   24 Hour Events:
 TRANSTHORACIC ECHO - At [**2136-11-3**] 09:30 AM:  The left atrium is
   dilated. There is mild symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy. The left
   ventricular cavity is moderately dilated. There is moderate global left
   ventricular hypokinesis (LVEF = 30-35 %). Tissue Doppler imaging
   suggests an increased left ventricular filling pressure (PCWP>18mmHg).
   The right ventricular cavity is mildly dilated with mild global free
   wall hypokinesis. The ascending aorta is mildly dilated. The aortic
   valve leaflets (3) are mildly thickened. There is mild aortic valve
   stenosis (area 1.2-1.9cm2). Mild (1+) aortic regurgitation is seen. The
   mitral valve leaflets are mildly thickened. There is no mitral valve
   prolapse. Mild (1+) mitral regurgitation is seen. There is mild
   pulmonary artery systolic hypertension. There is a trivial/physiologic
   pericardial effusion.
   IMPRESSION: Mild symmetric LVH with moderate global left ventricular
   hypokinesis. The inferior wall is nearly akinetic. Mild mitral and
   aortic regurgitation.

   Assessment and Plan
   79 M p/w STEMI from OSH, found to have 90% L-main, 100% RCA and w/
   cardiogenic shock requiring IABP.  Patient had stent placed to L-main.
   Was deemed non-operable candidate.
   #. Cardiogenic Shock: Patient weaned off IABP and tolerating well.
   Captopril 6.25 mg PO TID for afterload reduction, hold currently for
   low BP.
   -          hold beta-blocker, re-start Captopril when BP tolerates
   .
   #. CAD: CAD peaked at 400.  Continue [**Last Name (LF) **], [**First Name3 (LF) 119**], Statin and Heparin.
   .
   #. Pump: (LVEF = 30-35 %) Mild symmetric LVH with moderate global left
   ventricular hypokinesis. The inferior wall is nearly akinetic.
   -          diuresis goal  -1 L to
   -          Lasix 40 mg IV, follow I/O throughout day and give
   additional doses as needed
   -          Start coumadin due to high risk of thrombus with akinetic
   wall, bridge with Heparin ggt for 2 days
   .
   #. Rhythm: NSR
   .
   # Acute on Chronic RF: cr elevation likely [**2-25**] to poor cardiac output
   - unclear baseline.
   - hold IVF's given recent cardiogenic shock
   .
   # Cirrhosis: Most likely related to ETOH use. Decreased albumin,
   increased AST. LDH increased most likely secondary to ischemia.
   Continue to follow.
   .
   # LE PT Pulses
 dpable pulses. No vascular intervention needed,
   .
   #.mild dementia
   - cont aricept
   .
   #. FEN: Follow and replete electrolytes. Cardiac diet.
   .
   #. Sacral Decubitus Ulcer: Follow. No increase in WBC, Afebrile.
   .
   #. Access: PIVx2
   .
   #. PPx:
   .
   #. Code: full
   .
   #. Dispo: Pending Clinical above. PT consult.
Summary:
Summary of Progress Note:

The patient is a 79-year-old male who presented with a STEMI from OSH and was found to have 90% blockage in the left main artery and 100% blockage in the right coronary artery. He required an intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP) due to cardiogenic shock. The patient underwent stenting in the left main artery and was deemed a non-operative candidate.

The patient's vital signs include a temperature of 36.8째C (98.2째F), heart rate of 86 bpm, blood pressure ranging from 98/56 mmHg to 91/36 mmHg, respiratory rate of 21 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation of 98% on nasal cannula. The patient has a history of allergies to penicillins, and he is taking various medications including heparin sodium, captopril, acetaminophen, clopidogrel, allopurinol, donepezil, fexofenadine, citalopram, fluticasone, morphine sulfate, pantoprazole, aluminum-magnesium hydroxide-simethicone, atorvastatin, aspirin, and others.

The echocardiogram showed mild symmetric left ventricular hypertrophy, moderate global left ventricular hypokinesis with an ejection fraction of 30-35%, mild dilatation of the left ventricular cavity, and

Summary:
Summary of Progress Note:
- 79-year-old male patient with a history of STEMI from OSH, found to have 90% blockage in the left main artery and 100% blockage in the right coronary artery.
- The patient required intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP) due to cardiogenic shock.
- The patient had a stent placed in the left main artery.
- The patient is currently weaned off IABP and tolerating well.
- Medications include Captopril for afterload reduction, Statin, Heparin, Morphine sulfate for chest pain, Pantoprazole, Aspirin, Atorvastatin, and Clopidogrel.
- The patient's vital signs include a temperature of 36.8째C (98.2째F), heart rate of 86 bpm, blood pressure of 98/56 mmHg, respiratory rate of 21 breaths per minute, and oxygen saturation of 98% on nasal cannula.
- Physical examination shows no acute distress, distant heart sounds, diminished pulses in both radial and dorsal pedis arteries, symmetric chest expansion, coarse upper airway sounds, soft and non-tender abdomen, and no cyanosis or clubbing.
- Lab results indicate elevated troponin-T levels, increased white blood cell count, decreased hemoglobin levels, and elevated creatinine levels.
- The patient's assessment includes cardiogenic shock, coronary artery disease, reduced left ventricular e
